fields.title: Pumpkin Coffee Cake
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees
2. Com bine wet ingredients (pumpkin puree, 1/2 C brown sugar, canola oil, maple syrup, and whole milk) in a bowl
3. In a separate bowl combine dry ingredients (2 C flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, 2 tsp cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and ground ginger)
4. In another bowl mix crumble topping ingredients with a pastry cutter (1/2 C flour, 1/2 packed brown sugar, 1 1/2 tsp cinnamon, and cold diced butter
5. Slowly add dry ingredients to wet ingredients with a whisk until well incorporated
6. Spray down a 9x9 baking pan and then add all of the batter, spreading evenly
7. Top with all of the crumble mixture
8. Bake for 30-35 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.

fields.title: Hot Ham and Cheese Sliders
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees
2. Cut the top half off the hawaiian rolls
3. Add 1/2 lb deli meat of your choice to the bottom half
4. Add the shredded swiss cheese on top of the meat
5. Add the other 1/2 lb of deli meat
6. Put the tops of the rolls back on
7. Melt the sauce ingredients together in a pot and mix to combine (butter, honey mustard, dried parsley, garlic powder, and onion powder
8. Pour over the rolls
9. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes

fields.title: Salted Heath Chip Cookies
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 375 degrees and line sheet pans with parchment paper.
2. To a large bowl sift together flour, baking soda, baking powder and fine sea salt. Set aside.
3. To a separate bowl or stand mixer, beat softened butter with sugar and brown sugar (packed) until fluffy.
4. Add eggs, one at a time. Add vanilla. Blend until everything is incorporated.
5. Slowly add the dry ingredients into the wet. Blend until incorporated.
6. Pour toffee bits in the dough and fold in by hand.
7. Use a standard ice cream scoop to scoop dough out. Scrape along the top of the rim of the bowl to create the flat bottom of the cookie.
8. Bake 8 cookies at a time for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and immediately top with flakey salt.
9. Only bake one batch at a time. Makes 24-26 cookies.

fields.title: Maple Cinnamon Whipped Goat Cheese
fields.instructions:
1. Place room temp goat cheese + cream cheese into a food processor.
2. Add in cinnamon, maple syrup, and vanilla.
3. Pulse until you get a smooth, whipped texture.
4. Spoon onto a platter, and garnish with pomegranate seeds.
5. Finish by dusting with cinnamon and drizzling with maple syrup over the top.
6. Serve with pear slices, Raisin Rosemary Crisps, prosciutto, and fig jam.

fields.title: Crunchy Garlic Potatoes
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 450 degrees
2. Peel and cut potatoes in bite size pieces.
3. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the baking soda before adding the potatoes to the water.
4. Once the water reaches a low boil after adding the potatoes, set a timer for 7 minutes.
5. While the potatoes cook, to a separate pan heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and red pepper flakes and cook for 4-5 minutes until the garlic just starts to turn golden brown.
6. Strain the garlic and red pepper flakes and keel the oil.
7. Strain the potatoes. Let sit for 3 minutes to lose moisture.
8. Add potatoes to a large bowl and toss in the reserved garlic oil. Continue carefully tossing until a mashed layer forms around your potatoes.
9. Add to a large sheet pan and arrange in a single layer. Season with salt and pepper.
10. Bake for 25 minutes, toss, put back in for 20-25 more minutes until they're golden brown and crunchy on all sides.
11. Add the reserved garlic and red pepper flakes and toss. Serve warm.

fields.title: Mashed Potatoes
fields.instructions:
1. Peel 90% of the skin off the potatoes and cut into fourths or eighths based on size
2. Boil potatoes for 25 minutes
3. Melt butter and olive oil together and cook diced onion over low medium heat until deeply caramelized. Set aside.
4. Strain potatoes. Add half to a stand mixer followed by softened cream cheese, the rest of the potatoes and the heavy whipping cream. Beat with the paddle attachment for 5 seconds. Add the better than bouillon chicken base and sour cream, beat 5 more seconds. Add the parmesan cheese, salt and pepper, beat 5 more seconds. Add the caramelized onions and beat until everything is incorporated but you still have hunks of potato.
5. Serve with or without gravy.

fields.title: Southwest Chicken Chimichangas
fields.instructions:
1. Dice onion, red bell pepper and jalapeno.
2. To a pan over medium heat add olive oil and drippings from the rotisserie chicken bag and cook the onion, red bell pepper and jalapeno for 15 minutes.
3. While those cook, cut the kernels off 4 ears of corn, mince garlic and shred a rotisserie chicken or 3 chicken breasts.
4. Add the minced garlic. Stir and cook 2 minutes.
5. Add corn kernels, stir and cook 5 minutes.
6. Add salsa, stir then add rotisserie chicken. Stir. Add seasonings and stir.
7. Add black beans, stir.
8. Add chicken stock and bouillon granules, stir and simmer for 5 minutes.
9. Add diced avocado and gently stir.
10. Add chicken filling and shredded cheese to warmed flour tortillas. Place filling and cheese on the side closest to you and not directly in the middle. Roll up and secure with a toothpick. The size of your tortillas will determine how much filling and cheese you can put in.
11. Cook in a thin layer of preheated olive oil in a pan set over medium heat. Flip chimichangas every 20-30 seconds until all sides have a deep golden-brown color and are crisp on the outside.
12. Set on paper towels to absorb any residual oil. Remove the toothpick(s) used to keep the tortilla closed.
13. Cut in half if desired and serve with your favorite fixings.

fields.title: Creamy Sun Dried Tomato Chicken and Rice
fields.instructions:
1. Remove sundried tomatoes from oil and slice if they're bigger.
2. Melt butter over medium heat. Add shallots and cook 2 min. Add garlic and cook 2 min more. Add wine and allow to cook out for 2-3 min. Add the chicken stock and allow to thicken and reduce for 10-12 min. Pour in the heavy whipping cream, seasoning and whisk. Add the Parmesan and let thicken for a few minutes before adding the sundried tomatoes, spinach, rice and chicken to the skillet. Stir and serve.

fields.title: Shrimp and Grits
fields.instructions:
1. Cook off a pound of bacon
2. Dice up a red onion, red bell pepper
3. Cook vegetables for 15 minutes in the leftover bacon fat on medium heat
4. Add can of diced petite tomatoes and cook another 10 minutes
5. Add garlic and cook 10 minutes
6. Break down veggies with a pastry cutter
7. Deglaze with white wine
8. Once cooked out add heavy whipping cream and seasonings to the pan and cook for 5 minutes
9. Add large peeled devined shrimp to the pan and cook until pink
10. Serve along soft goat cheese, grits, or polenta

fields.title: Bourbon Chicken
fields.instructions:
1. Trim extra fat off chicken thighs. Place in a bowl with zesty Italian dressing mix and olive oil. Mix and lay in a single layer on a large sheet pan. Bake at 375 for 45 minutes.
2. Once the chicken is cooked cut into bite size pieces and set aside.
3. Add the oil to a wok over medium heat and cook the garlic for 2 minutes. Add the rest of the sauce ingredients and whisk. Turn the heat to high and let it thicken for 3-4 minutes.
4. Turn heat back down to medium and add chicken to the wok. Stir and allow it to heat through before serving.

fields.title: Arroz Con Pollo
fields.instructions:
1. In a crockpot add the evaporated milk, velveeta queso blanco, monterey jack cheese, jalapeno, and rotel tomatoes
2. Cook the queso for 90 minutes on low heat
3. Cook yellow onion in oil over medium heat for 10 minutes 
4. Add minced garlic and cook for 2 minutes more
5. Add chicken stock, tomato sauce, Better than bullion chicken base, and 1 tsp salt. Whisk and bring to a boil.
6. Add Minute rice, stir, cover, and turn the heat off
7. Trim and pound chicken breasts, towel dry and season liberally on both sides with garlic powder, cumin, remaining salt, onion powder, ancho chili powder, black pepper and paprika
8. Cook for 7-8 minutes per side based on thickness in oil just a hair under medium heat
9. Fluff your rice after 20 minutes
10. Cook the chicken once it's rested for 10 minutes
11. Lay on a bed of rice and ladle queso on top

fields.title: Award Winning Chili
fields.instructions:
1. Cook ground chuck and strain the fat out of the meat
2. Dice yellow onions and throw in the pot to soften along with meat and minced garlic
3. Cook until onions are translucent
4. Add the rest of the ingredients to the pot (except the kidney beans)
5. Stir and cover for 1 hour
6. Add kidney beans, stir, cover and let cook for 2 more hours
7. Stir occasionally
8. When finished add your favorite toppings

fields.title: Fettuccine Alfredo
fields.instructions:
1. Melt butter just under medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook for 3 minutes. Stir often and make sure the garlic doesn't brown.
2. Add heavy whipping cream. Whisk until the butter and cream come together. It will seem like they repel each other but keep whisking.
3. Once blended let thicken for about 10 minutes. Whisking often. Add grated parmesan cheese and black pepper. Whisk and let cook until all the cheese has melted, about 5 minutes.
4. Prepare fettuccini noodles to al dente, strain and serve.

fields.title: Brownie Buckeye Cookies
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees
2. To a bowl add brownie mix, melted butter, softened cream cheese and an egg. Mix by hand until everything is incorporated. Set aside.
3. To a separate bowl mix the powdered sugar and peanut butter together by hand until incorporated.
4. Scoop rounded tablespoons of the brownie dough and form a ball. Place on parchment lined sheet pans. Smooth out the edges of each cookie and place a thumb print in the middle of each one.
5. Scoop 1/2 tablespoons of the peanut fudge mixture and form a ball. Place one peanut butter ball in the divot of each cookie. Flatten it down a little.
6. Bake on 350 for 11 minutes.
7. Let rest on the sheet pans on the counter until they completely cool to room temperature.
8. Spread on a thin layer of canned fudge icing.

fields.title: Cajun Shrimp Pasta
fields.instructions:
1. Thaw shrimp.
2. Melt butter over medium heat. Add garlic. Stir with a wooden spoon. Cook 1 minute.
3. Add strained petite diced tomatoes to the pan. Cook 10 minutes. Smash tomatoes with your wooden spoon once softened.
4. Add chicken stock, clam juice, green onions and seasoning. Mix. Simmer for 5 minutes.
5. Add raw shrimp. Mix. Once they're pink add heavy whipping cream. Cook 1 minute.
6. Add grated parmesan cheese. Stir and allow to thicken for a few minutes.
7. Ladle over linguine noodles and serve with a side of crusty bread.

fields.title: Cheesy Chicken & Broccoli Casserole
fields.instructions:
1. Crush the Ritz crackers and mix with 5 tbsp of melted butter
2. Cube 1 stick of butter and combine with the rest of the ingredients in a deep casserole dish
3. Top with the crackers mixture
4. Bake at 350 for 45 min or until it's hot and the topping is golden brown.

fields.title: Peanut Butter Sheet Pan Brownies
fields.instructions:
1. Combine 12 tbsp softened butter, light brown sugar and sugar with a hand mixer until fluffy
2. Add smooth peanut butter and mix again
3. Add eggs and 2 tsp vanilla and mix one more time
4. In a separate bowl combine your dry ingredients (flour, baking powder and salt)
5. Mix in the dry ingredients, batter will be pretty thick
6. Line a 18 by 13  sheet pan with parchment paper and spread the brownie mixture on top 
7. Bake at 350 for 19 min or until a toothpick comes out clean
8. Beat 1 stick softened butter in a large bowl then sift in the powdered sugar and cocoa powder
9. Pour in 2 tsp of vanilla and warm milk
10. Beat until silky smooth
11. Spread the icing on the cooled sheet pan and cut into squares and enjoy or put in the fridge for later

fields.title: Cheesy Chicken Enchiladas
fields.instructions:
1. Trim and pound chicken so it's even thickness on all sides. Pat dry. Season liberally with all seasonings listed. No need to measure.
2. Set a pan a hair under medium heat. Preheat olive oil for 3-4 minutes and cook chicken breasts for 8 minutes per side. Let rest for 10 minutes then shred.
3. To the same pan the chicken cooked in add some more oil and soften a diced purple onion for 10 minutes. Add minced garlic and cook 2 minutes more.
4. Pour in chipotle sauce, petite diced tomatoes, shredded chicken and a cup of frozen corn. Mix and cook for 5 minutes.
5. Microwave tortillas so they're pliable.
6. Add about 1/2 C filling to each tortilla on the bottom side of the tortilla (not in the middle). Fold in the sides first, then start at the bottom where the filling is and and roll up, holding the sides in the entire time.
7. Place enchiladas in a 9x13 pan and cover with all of the shredded cheese.
8. Bake at 350 until the cheese is melted. Broil at the end for more color.
9. Warm canned enchilada sauce in a saucepan over medium heat until heated through. Ladle over individual servings of the enchiladas for those that want it.
10. Garnish with cilantro

fields.title: Chocolate Chipless Cookies
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
2. To a bowl sift flour, baking powder, baking soda and sea salt. Set aside.
3. To a bowl or stand mixer cream together softened butter and sugar until fluffy.
4. Add eggs and vanilla and continue mixing until everything is combined.
5. Slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. Mix until everything is incorporated.
6. Scoop dough with a traditional ice cream scoop (lever cleans out the scoop) and use the edge of the bowl to scrape the scoop to create the flat bottom of the cookie.
7. Bake cookies in rounds on a parchment lined sheet pan one batch at a time at 375 for 10 minutes.
8. Immediately top with flaky salt when they come out of the oven. Cool to room temperature.
9. Place chocolate chips in a glass bowl fitted over a simmering pot of water set on medium heat. Make sure the water isn't touching the bottom of the bowl. Stir occasionally until the chocolate is fully melted.
10. Turn heat to low. Dip the bottom of the cookie in the melted chocolate and scrape excess off with the back of a table knife. You can also just spoon the chocolate on and spread out with a knife and scrape excess.
11. Lay cookies chocolate-side up on a room temperature cookie sheet and place in the freezer for 10 minutes for the chocolate to harden.

fields.title: Creamed Spinach
fields.instructions:
1. Thaw frozen spinach and squeeze all the water out. Set aside.
2. Melt butter over medium heat. Cook onion for 10 minutes, stirring often. Add garlic and cook 2 minutes more.
3. Pour in heavy whipping cream and allow to thicken for 10 minutes, stirring often. Add cream cheese, mozzarella cheese, salt and pepper. Let fully incorporate for 5 minutes.
4. Add parmesan cheese and that spinach. Stir well. Cook 2 minutes then add red pepper flakes. Stir once more and serve.

fields.title: Crispy Cheesy Chicken Tacos
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 400 convection or 425 regular
2. To a pan over medium heat with oil cook diced onion and red bell pepper for 10 minutes.
3. Add garlic and cook 2 more minutes.
4. Add either one 4 oz can of green chilis or one 8 oz can or original Rotel and cook for 10 minutes. If using Rotel, break down the tomatoes with a wooden spoon.
5. Add salsa verde and all the seasoning, stir.
6. Add frozen corn, shredded rotisserie chicken and cilantro and stir. Let cook until the corn is warmed through.
7. Microwave white corn tortillas for one minute. Spray down both sides of each tortilla with oil and fill the top half of the taco shell with about 1/3 C of chicken filling. Top the chicken mixture with about 1/4 c shredded cheese.
8. Fold each taco over and cook on a parchment lined baking sheet. You can fit 9-12 tacos on a single sheet pan. 9. Bake for 10 minutes.
10. Remove the sheet pan, spray the tacos down again on the side that's facing up then flip over and put back in the oven for 8-10 more minutes.

fields.title: Crispy Fish Tacos
fields.instructions:
1. Bake fish for 20 min then flip and cook 7 minutes more. Cut corn off 4 ears of corn. Melt butter, add corn and cook 5 minutes over medium heat. Add sugar and seasoning and cook for 10 minutes. You want the starch taste gone but you still want the corn to snap in your mouth.
2. Mix avocado crema ingredients together. Not hard.
